poem:
Title: In the Light of Conflict's Morn

Morning's paper, heavy with ink,
Sings a story of might and link,
Of drones in flight, and a ship's sad sink,
Off Crimea's coast, in the absence of clink.

Naval skirmish danced in silent ballet,
Over waves aglow in dawn's outcry,
Yet in the end, amid sea's reply,
Echoes the world's collective sigh.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ukraine claims to have sunk Russian landing ship in drone attack Ukraine claims to have severely damaged and sunk a Russian landing ship in its latest drone attack against Moscow’s Black Sea fleet. Ukrainian military intelligence released video on Wednesday that it said showed several naval drones approaching the Ropucha-class large landing ship Cesar Kunikov off the coast of Crimea. The drones hit the port side of the ship, the agency said in a statement,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
